From: Colin Green <colin.green1@...>

On 7 May 2015 at 00:27, Colin Green <colin.green1@...> wrote:
>
> RMSProp follows *all* *steady* gradients at the same speed, regardless
> of steepness. Why? because the step size is no longer proportional to
> gradient, but instead is proportional to:
>
> (1)     gradient / mean_of_recent_gradients

Another key point here is that the above implies that RMSProp won't
gracefully come to a stop at the bottom of a gradient. Say we
descended to the base of a bowl shape (convex bowl); RMSProp will jump
around the mimum point forever, whereas plain GD will approach it
asymptotically. This is probably a weakness of RMSProp, but there
might be some benefits to hopping around like that while the other
variables are still following /their/ graidients [conjecture].

Colin
